alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 17 at 4:38PM MST until July 17 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County near Camp Verde in west central Arizona... * Until 745 PM MST. * At 437 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Camp Verde, Rimrock, Montezuma Well, Lake Montezuma, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Mcguireville and Clear Creek Campgrounds. This includes the following swimming holes... Bull Pen Day Use Area, West Clear Creek near the campground and Indian Maiden Falls. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 220 and 242. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Gaddis Wash, Verde River, Walker Creek, Bull Run Creek, West Clear Creek, Dry Beaver Creek, Russell Wash, Rarick Canyon, Fossil Creek and Beaver Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
